ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English 'celyng', derived from the verb 'celen' (to ceil), which comes from Anglo-French 'celer' (to cover, conceal), ultimately from Latin 'celare' (to hide). Originally referred to the action of covering a room with a ceiling.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: n: noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The upper interior surface of a room or other enclosed space.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 房间或其他封闭空间的顶部内表面。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We painted the bedroom ceiling light blue to make the room feel more open.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们把卧室的天花板漆成了浅蓝色，让房间感觉更开阔。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: n: noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An upper limit, typically one that is imposed or fixed, especially on prices, wages, or expenditure.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 上限，特别是对价格、工资或开支等设定的上限。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The government imposed a ceiling on rent increases to protect tenants.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 政府对租金上涨设定了上限，以保护租户。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: n: noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Aviation/Meteorology) The maximum altitude at which an aircraft can operate efficiently, or the height of the base of the lowest layer of clouds.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （航空/气象）飞机能有效运行的最高高度，或最低云层的底部高度。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Due to the low cloud ceiling, all flights were delayed until further notice.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 由于云层高度低，所有航班都被推迟，直至另行通知。

REGISTER: General, with technical uses in aviation and economics.
